intro: Galium divaricatum, commonly known as variable bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming from June to August. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Galium divaricatum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
